intro: Brachystelma rubellum, commonly known as the red-stemmed stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its red stems and pink or purple flowers make it a striking addition to rock gardens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
